comment_text.mn132:4.1: Ānanda goes on to repeat the analysis as in the previous discourse, MN 131:4.1ff.

root_text.mn132:1.2: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
root_text.mn132:2.1: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ānando upaṭṭhānasālāyaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṁseti, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca bhāsati.
root_text.mn132:2.2: Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenupaṭṭhānasālā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
root_text.mn132:2.4: “ko nu kho, bhikkhave, upaṭṭhānasālāyaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca abhāsī”ti?
root_text.mn132:2.5: “Āyasmā, bhante, ānando upaṭṭhānasālāyaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca abhāsī”ti.
root_text.mn132:2.6: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
root_text.mn132:2.7: “yathā kathaṁ pana tvaṁ, ānanda, bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca abhāsī”ti?
root_text.mn132:3.1: “Evaṁ kho ahaṁ, bhante, bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesiṁ samādapesiṁ samuttejesiṁ sampahaṁsesiṁ, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca abhāsiṁ—
root_text.mn132:4.2: Evaṁrūpo ahosiṁ atītamaddhānanti tattha nandiṁ samanvāneti, evaṁvedano ahosiṁ atītamaddhānanti tattha nandiṁ samanvāneti, evaṁsañño ahosiṁ atītamaddhānanti tattha nandiṁ samanvāneti, evaṁsaṅkhāro ahosiṁ atītamaddhānanti tattha nandiṁ samanvāneti, evaṁviññāṇo ahosiṁ atītamaddhānanti tattha nandiṁ samanvāneti—
root_text.mn132:5.2: Evaṁrūpo ahosiṁ atītamaddhānanti tattha nandiṁ na samanvāneti, evaṁvedano ahosiṁ atītamaddhānanti tattha nandiṁ na samanvāneti, evaṁsañño ahosiṁ atītamaddhānanti tattha nandiṁ na samanvāneti, evaṁsaṅkhāro ahosiṁ atītamaddhānanti tattha nandiṁ na samanvāneti, evaṁviññāṇo ahosiṁ atītamaddhānanti tattha nandiṁ na samanvāneti—
root_text.mn132:6.2: Evaṁrūpo siyaṁ anāgatamaddhānanti tattha nandiṁ samanvāneti, evaṁvedano siyaṁ …pe…
root_text.mn132:6.5: evaṁviññāṇo siyaṁ anāgatamaddhānanti tattha nandiṁ samanvāneti—
root_text.mn132:7.2: Evaṁrūpo siyaṁ anāgatamaddhānanti tattha nandiṁ na samanvāneti, evaṁvedano siyaṁ …pe…
root_text.mn132:7.5: evaṁviññāṇo siyaṁ anāgatamaddhānanti tattha nandiṁ na samanvāneti—
root_text.mn132:8.2: Idha, āvuso, assutavā puthujjano ariyānaṁ adassāvī ariyadhammassa akovido ariyadhamme avinīto sappurisānaṁ adassāvī sappurisadhammassa akovido sappurisadhamme avinīto
root_text.mn132:8.3: rūpaṁ attato samanupassati, rūpavantaṁ vā attānaṁ, attani vā rūpaṁ, rūpasmiṁ vā attānaṁ;
root_text.mn132:8.7: viññāṇaṁ attato samanupassati, viññāṇavantaṁ vā attānaṁ, attani vā viññāṇaṁ, viññāṇasmiṁ vā attānaṁ—
root_text.mn132:8.8: evaṁ kho, āvuso, paccuppannesu dhammesu saṁhīrati.
root_text.mn132:9.1: Kathañca, āvuso, paccuppannesu dhammesu na saṁhīrati?
root_text.mn132:9.2: Idha, āvuso, sutavā ariyasāvako ariyānaṁ dassāvī ariyadhammassa kovido ariyadhamme suvinīto sappurisānaṁ dassāvī sappurisadhammassa kovido sappurisadhamme suvinīto
root_text.mn132:9.3: na rūpaṁ attato samanupassati, na rūpavantaṁ vā attānaṁ, na attani vā rūpaṁ, na rūpasmiṁ vā attānaṁ;
root_text.mn132:9.7: na viññāṇaṁ attato samanupassati, na viññāṇavantaṁ vā attānaṁ, na attani vā viññāṇaṁ, na viññāṇasmiṁ vā attānaṁ—
root_text.mn132:9.8: evaṁ kho, āvuso, paccuppannesu dhammesu na saṁhīrati.
root_text.mn132:11.1: Evaṁ kho ahaṁ, bhante, bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesiṁ samādapesiṁ samuttejesiṁ sampahaṁsesiṁ, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca abhāsin”ti.
root_text.mn132:11.3: Sādhu kho tvaṁ, ānanda, bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca abhāsi:
root_text.mn132:13-19.10: evaṁ kho, ānanda, paccuppannesu dhammesu saṁhīrati.
root_text.mn132:13-19.11: Kathañca, ānanda, paccuppannesu dhammesu na saṁhīrati …pe…
root_text.mn132:13-19.12: evaṁ kho, ānanda, paccuppannesu dhammesu na saṁhīrati.
root_text.mn132:13-19.18: Attamano āyasmā ānando bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandīti.

translation_text.mn132:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
translation_text.mn132:2.1: Now at that time Venerable Ānanda was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants in the assembly hall with a Dhamma talk on the topic of the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night.
translation_text.mn132:2.2: Then in the late afternoon, the Buddha came out of retreat, went to the assembly hall, where he sat on the seat spread out,
translation_text.mn132:2.4: “Who was inspiring the mendicants with a talk on the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night?”
translation_text.mn132:2.6: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Ānanda,
translation_text.mn132:2.7: “But in what way were you inspiring the mendicants with a talk on the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night?”
translation_text.mn132:3.1: “I was doing so in this way, sir,” replied Ānanda.
translation_text.mn132:3.7: you clearly discern in every case.
translation_text.mn132:3.10: Today’s the day to keenly work—
translation_text.mn132:3.11: who knows, tomorrow may bring death!
translation_text.mn132:3.12: For there is no bargain to be struck
translation_text.mn132:3.13: with Death and his mighty horde.
translation_text.mn132:3.14: One who keenly meditates like this,
translation_text.mn132:3.16: that’s who has one fine night—
translation_text.mn132:4.1: And how do you run back to the past? …
translation_text.mn132:5.1: And how do you not run back to the past? …
translation_text.mn132:6.1: And how do you anticipate the future? …
translation_text.mn132:7.1: And how do you not anticipate the future? …
translation_text.mn132:8.1: And how do you falter amid presently arisen phenomena? …
translation_text.mn132:9.1: And how do you not falter amid presently arisen phenomena? …
translation_text.mn132:9.8: That’s how you don’t falter amid presently arisen phenomena.
translation_text.mn132:10.15: that’s who has one fine night—
translation_text.mn132:11.1: That’s how I was inspiring the mendicants with a talk on the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night.”
translation_text.mn132:11.3: It’s good that you were inspiring the mendicants with a talk on the summary recital and the analysis of the one who has one fine night.”
translation_text.mn132:13-19.1: And the Buddha repeated the verses and analysis once more.
translation_text.mn132:13-19.17: That is what the Buddha said.
translation_text.mn132:13-19.18: Satisfied, Venerable Ānanda approved what the Buddha said.
